text: 355ml bottle. Jet black colour with average, thick, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, tan head. Chocolately, minimally roasty, dark malty aroma, hints of plum, raisin, a touch of coffee, some liquorice. Taste is roasty dark malty, chocolately, sweet-ish hints of caramel, burnt caramel, some coffee, liquorice, alcohol-soaked dark fruit; full body, oily texture, sticky palate.
Aus der Flasche 2015-09 getrunken. Ein wunderbares kräftiges Porter. Überraschen süffig für seine 9%!
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and licorice. Sweet tasteight bitterness, with a warm chocolate and coffee end

Graandiosa portes negra absoluta y con una espuma muy cremosa y agradable. De intenso aroma. De gran intensid y espesor en boca sin unos tonos demasiado marcadospero q se nota el alcohol. De sabor muy agradable sin excesos en los matices. Muy agradable. Bebida en casa con tranquilidad. Deja un regusto a maderas y un leve tono a cacao no chocolate. Muy recomendable

De couleur brune avec une mince dentelle sur la paroi du verre. Un nez tendre de café, de chocolat, de noisette, cest boisé avec des traces de petits fruits noir.

En bouche, cest un assemblage soyeux de chocolat et de café, des notes de petits fruits noir. Le raisin y est omniprésent et englobe toutes ces saveurs. Lalcool est presque imperceptible.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat, enjoyed at Gunnarsbu. Pours black with a big creamy tan head. Aroma of creamy dark malts, dark fruits, cellar and chocolate. Taste is soft creamy malts, distinct notes of dark fruits, with liquorice at the finish, good porter this one

Clear but very dark almost brown and an off white creamy head. Aroma is molasses with some raisins and slight tobacco notes. Flavor is same dark fruits, with cake, a little bit of toffee and a gentle bittersweet finish. Just a little bit boozy, but overall very smooth and creamy.

Wygląd poprawny. Czarny z łatwo budującą się jasnoberzową pianą. Niezbyt trwałą. W aromacie uderza alkohol. Szlachetny. Burbon, whiskey? Na drugim planie ciemne słody, czekolada i charakterystyczne dla Porterów razowe pieczywo. W smaku odrobinę lepiej. Na początku porterowe pieczywo. Na finiszu alkohol obmywająca podniebienie. Niezbyt treściwe i gęste.

13.04.2017, 12 oz bottle with slightly damaged cap @ home:
No head, just some bubbles. Aroma is slightly sweet sour-ish roasted, dark malts, dark sugar, licorice, grass, minerals, alcohol, bark, hints of sour coffee. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish mineraly, weeds, hay, minerals, bark, dark malts, alcohol, paper, hay, sour-ish roasted grain, sour coffee, hints of licorice and sour caramel. Medium bitterness, harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Probably gone a little bad because of the damages cap.

Deeply black and a small tan foam. Aroma of red fruit, chocolate, coffee, nuts, chestnut, dark caramel, but not roasted. The same in the mouth and somehow spicy, maybe because of the alcohol content. Highly sweet and highly bitter at the same time. Full bodied, sticky. Its a gorgeous beer but Id prefer it with a smoother bitterness as this style would require.

12 oz can. At the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Black color with a small tan head.
Roasted malt, sweetness, coffee, darkness, mild vanilla and toffee in the aroma. 
The flavor is roasted malt, licorice, cough syrup, ash, sweetness and mild coffee. Rich and super balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From my brother: pours black with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, light chocolate. Taste is roasty. Kind of sweet, but not really. Some booze in there. Good baltic.

355ml bottle. Pours a clear, nearly black with a thin beige head that fades quickly. Aroma has big notes of caramel, roasted malts, dark fruits, dark chocolate, and hints of coffee. Taste is balanced well with notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, dark fruits, molasses, and a drawn out, roasty dark fruits ending. Full body with a low-medium carbonation. Round and rich in the mouth with a soft, dry finish. Overall a big, round, rich, roasty beer.

Wyraźna, ale nie dominująca paloność miesza się z silną gorzką czekoladą z dużą zawartością kakao, a do tego rodzynki i śliwki. Deser z mlecznej czekolady, nadal nutka bourbonu i lekka kawa w tle. Po ogrzaniu minimalna kwaskowatość od palonego słodu, ale ogólnie słodkie, bardzo gęste, pozostałości osadzone na szkle są widoczne bardzo wyraźnie, ale nie chcą spływać. Alkohol świetnie ukryty. Rewelacyjna kompozycja

Bottle 355ml. Black with a medium beige head. Some earthiness and soy sauce (teriyaki?) in the aroma. Palate not as creamy as expected, unfortunately. Taste is pure with chocloate, vanilla , coffee and som saltiness. Well balanced bitterness, but not as full-bodied as expected.

Soft and smooth with lots of coffee and emphasizing licorice nuances. Very good.

Bottle. Dark brown body, small chocolate head with poor retention, no lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, smoked prunes, dried berries, wood notes, tobacco and leather. Taste of smoked prunes, dark chocolate, dried blueberries, licorice, woodsy and herbal. Complex but a bit harsh and boozy.

Aroma is chocolates and roasted malts with a light raisin touch. Taste is smooth coffee, light licorice and soy sauce. Light creamy and velvety in a way, and at the same time dark fruity. Low-medium carbonation. Excellent example of the style

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Bottle, LCBO. BB 5 Oct 2018. 9.0% ABV. Pours extremely dark brown with rather modest light beige head. Chocolate fudge cake aroma and flavour with a bit of BP sourness reminiscent of black rye bread crust and red berries, but most of it is just fudge. Finishes with a bit of a licorice moment. Raisins soaked in liquor goodiness. Soft and smooth mouthfeel, very modest carbonation (would love a bit more), thick body. Maybe the slight cold is dumbing down this one for me but no worries since it was only sold as a 4-pack. Will get back to this!

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, liquroice, caramel, some alcohol.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, roasted malt, alcohol, some chocolate.

355 ml bottle purchase at the LCBO at Rideau and King Edward (Ottawa) on January 3, 2017. Black, thin head. Aroma of dark chocolate and raisins, a bit of raw barley. Malty smoke chocolate taste, notes of sweet ripe fruit, nice barley bitterness. That label is right!
dark cola brown pour with decent tan head. Earthy aroma. taste has hints of coffee and toasted malt. Semi-sweet but with some good bitter as well. Pleasant warming finish. Great beer!

Black or almost so. Thin tan head, decent persistence, some lacing. Quite intense aroma shows dark fruits, molasses and chocolate among a general sweet feel. Hints of roasted malts and coffee, but pretty much on the back. Taste is quite on the sweet side as the smell suggested, with a hint of slightly earthy bitterness showing up in the finish. Hint of roasted malts, coffee, molasses, dark fruits. Slight alcohol warmth. Medium body, low carbonation, slightly creamy. Overall quite flavourful and enjoyable, but not too impressive. Roasted malts and coffee are on the low side but they kind of felt like not perfectly integrated.

12 oz single bottle from Total Wine & More - Gilbert, AZ. Black appearance with a tan head and light lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, light smoke, coffee, bitter chocolate and a hint of dark fruits. Similar flavor, rich, moderately sweet and lightly bitter with a lingering roasted, light smoky finish. Medium to full body. Slightly acidic and a little on the sweet side, but pretty nice overall.

Bottle at Baltic Porter Day 2017 - DobryZbeer Gliwice

Lots of intense choc on aroma. Its got a touch of ash, roasted, big choc and some good harsh intense choc. I was expect much more from this beer. Quite nice, but not of tops

Draft Half Pint at White Horse, Parsons Green, London in Aug 2010 - Dark Brown / Black in colour. Very Malty; roasted malts, coffee, molasses, dark chocolate, toffee. Fruity; dark fruit, raisins. Hoppy; light hop bitterness. Vinous; port-like. Sweet roast coffee chocolate malty with a slightly sour fruit/hop edge. Very smooth. Lovely Stuff. Superb Porter! (2010-08)
Flaska. Svartbrun vätska. Rostad doft med kaffe, bränt socker och mörk choklad. Söt smak av sirap, chokladkaka och rostad malt

Bottle. Dark brown, tan foam. Aroma: malty, slightly smoky, caramel, prunes, dried fruits and port wine. Taste: light sweetness, prunes, roasted, caramel, port wine, brandy, dried fruit, soft and good balanced, creamy, velvety.

4pack from the lcbo. Jet black pour, big mocha head. Aroma is incredibly roasty, but also has a lovely round fruitiness. Hints of soy and milk chocolate, and subtle hazelnut. Oily mouth feel, nice carb. Finish is medium bitter, loads more roast, some smoke, and fruity. Really nice stuff.

Svart med lite brunbeiget skum.
Doft: Soja, kavring, syrligt kaffe, citron, mörk choklad, cognac.
Smak: salt, kavring, soja, citron, syrligt/beskt kaffe, lite choklad i bakgrunden. lite väl kärv för min smak. med choklad: lenare, bränt socker, coca-cola, kaffe-runt, betydligt trevligare!

Complete black stuff with a thick nice beige head that leaves a fine lacing. Good intensity in the aroma. Full body and a smooth carbonation level. Mellow nice sweetness. Lovely mix between cocoa, chocolate and espresso coffee in the flavor. Lovely evening sipper.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]
Bottle poured into a snifter. Poured nearly black with a thin tan head. Aroma of coffee and dark fruit.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with licorice, chocolate and dark bread. Dry finish

Schwerst verölt und verflixt BLACK!!! Salmiak, Kakao, Kaffee und Bohnen im allgemeinen 😉, treiben den Aromenirrsinn ins Nirvana. Hart am Limit, das Ganze. Ein sanft rotfruchtgepeitschtes Oatmealmundgefühl, gepaart mit dem roggigen Korpus, bilden das Rückrad für diesen ordentlich versüßbitterten Zaubertrunk. Good to drink ist er auch noch. Trotzdem nur für Opas und Beer Geeks geeignet. Intensiv und manchmal echt lemonsauer. Nice job. 355ml Bottle from ????
SB Kalmar flaska. Svart med fint skum och lite torr kritaktig arom. Dugligt gravöl (Astrid. Skulle inte tyckt om den). Frisk bränd fikonsmak. Black lager med impS utseende. Bra gillar den.
Flaska. Svart öl med ett beigt skum. Dofter av kaffe och rostad malt. Smakinslag av kaffe, lakritsrot, asfalt och rostad malt. Oljig munkänsla.

Pours thick and black from the bottle, leaving a finger thick tan head that soon subsides to a creamy layer. The aroma is smoke, caramel, tart berry, and lightly alcoholic. An interesting mix. Taste is bitter with burnt notes, coffee, toast. Overall a very heavy and demanding sort of beer, not the sort of thing that fits in innocuously with a meal. Too big, brash, and burnt. The finish pushes leaves lightly sweeter, with chocolate notes coming to the forefront before fading out amidst the warming alcohol. Did I mention this was heavy? Dont think Ill be needing dinner after this. Good.

Butelka z datą do stycznia 2015. Pierwszy amerykański bałtyk, jaki miałem okazję pić. Piwo po terminie, więc w sam raz. W aromacie dominuje tandem kawy i czekolady, występują też ewidentne nuty utlenienia w stronę miodu, ciemnych owoców. Lekki akcent dymu to zapewne zasługa palonych słodów. W smaku treściwe, szlachetne, alkohol ułożony, oblepiające. Gorzka czekolada, marcepan, kawa to główne dominanty smaku. Odczuwalne ciało w sposób przyjemny, rozgrzewający. Świetne piwo.

Pours a dark brown with a tan foam head. Nose a bit muted - some faint coffee and malt, but not much. Taste is black licorice, some smoke, and bitterness and a hint of alcohol on the finish. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Svart öl med ett gräddigt beige skum. Doft av rostad malt, choklad och kaffe. I smaken tillkommer mörkt socker och lättare lakritstoner.

Svart med ett brun-"grått" skum. Doft: Kaffe, rostat, katrinplommon, mörk kola, kakao, lätt bränt socker, lite vanilj. Stark 7:a. Smak: Rostat, kakao, likör, söt lakrits, trä, sött kaffe, rostat fullkornsbröd.

Bottle from lcbo. Pours black with some tan frothy head and minimal lacing. Nose is espresso and raisins. Flavours of raisin, brown bread, espresso, some tobacco. Taste med bitter med/big sweet. Medium body medium carbonation with lasting bitterness. Alcohol is pretty well hidden.

January 6, 2017. Bottle. 
Very dark brown, almost black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted and malty with chocolate, plum, licorice, hints of ash and some earthy coffee notes. 
Taste is light to medium sweet, malty, some fruity berry notes, Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is smooth roasted notes with coffee, some chocolate, slight earthy herbal notes, sweet malty and dark berry notes. 
Solid.

0,355 l bottle from Biervana 
chocolate, roasty, caramel, hints of vanilla, dark brown - black color, hazy, frothy / creamy brown foam head. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Deep brown color, brown head. Licorice nose, malty, caramel, dried fruit, spicy notes. Roasted malt taste, brown sugar, licorice, bitter coffee, dark chocolate. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily and thick texture.

Tastes like licking the inside of a charred barrel, very strong notes of charcoal and tons of roasted malts in the flavour. Chewy palate, big beer, pours black with tan head, really thick. Texture of dark chocolate, bitter, quite intense. Wow.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
No head. Clear black color. Extremely good roasted malty and nice chocolate and coffee aroma. Caramel and chocolate taste but not sweet. Smooth taste with balanced bitterness and a full body.

330 ml bottle. Quiet pour with medium carbonation. Dark opaque colour, tan head, and good lace. The aroma is roasted barley, yeast, and a suggestion of dark dried fruit. The taste is smooth roasted barley with notes of dark fruit expanding into the middle. The finish is long and complex with hints of molasses, some hop dryness, and just a touch of alcohol warmth. Well done!
Big creamy dark chocolate aromas. Dark thick brown with a creamy brown head. Thick like drinking a shake but really great roasted flavors with a nice touch of coal bitterness.
(bottle) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of jam, stewed fruit; rich, balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish; thick palate
Svart med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter kakaopulver, svisker, kaffe og mørk sjokolade. Middels fylde. Noe salt lakris, kaffe, mørk sjokolade, sitrusskall og krydder. Middels minus i lengde.
Svart farge med beige skum. Lukter av mørke stenfrukter, parfyme og noe krydder. Medium fylde. Smaker av kaffe og kjenner sødme. Litt tørr i avslutningen.

Belle mousse à grosses bulles chocolatées, liquide épais et parfaitement opaque, noir comme les confins de lespace. Nez de cacao et de raisins secs. La bouche est délicatement soyeuse, un peu amère à la fin mais plutôt axée solidement sur les malts, qui oscillent entre le chocolat, le café, les dattes et les prunes. Savoureuse, onctueuse, pas nécessairement explosive doriginalité, mais diablement délicieuse.

Small brown head doesnt last. Opaque black body. Deep raisiny toasty earthy aroma with dried fruit notes. Sweet floral fruity raisiny taste with toasted blackberry leaf notes. Full-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel, with slight heat. Sweetish toasty licorice aftertaste with fruity spicy raisiny notes. Lovely! Full of flavour, harmonic, rich. (0.355l bottle, from ... actually, I dont remember.)

Much scent of licorice. The flavor of coffee, chocolate and soy. Good bitterness that fills the upper and front part of the mouth for a long time. Good beer but not so special. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
355ml bottle. Pitch black body with pretty much no head. Roasted notes, coffee, hint of dark fruit, some burnt notes.

Bottle at home.
Pitch black colored with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, chocolate and dried fruits.
Roasted flavor of caramel, dried fruits and chocolate.
Roasted finish.

Bottled. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits notes and licorice. Sweet flavor that ends dry and with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Porter. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

It pours opaque black; the head is caramel and fluffy. The aroma has notes of: liquorice, leather, anise, rum, dark chocolate, and burnt sugar. The taste is heavy bitter. The palate is full bodied, has light carbonation, and has a long finish. Overall, its got an amazing mouthfeel.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 This is my 999th rating. A couple of bottles I found in a gourmet store around the Rivertown mall in Grand Rapids. So lucky, as this is not one of the Smuttynoses that one finds in regular beer stores in the places I get to go. I knew about its fame, as USAs best-rated Baltic Porter. It is certainly among the best. Wonderful nose of berries, very vinous, sweet cherries, some tartness, dried fruit, liquorice and even a touch of dark chocolate. Great start. The beer pours very dark brown to be onyx black in the glass, with a decent brown head, not as creamy as perfection would dictate, but still formidable. Flavours of dark bitter chocolate, prunes, tart cherries, salty liquorice and fudge, quite smoothly sweet, vinous as the aroma and hardly any sourness. A bit of an export stout bitterness, with soy sauce and ketjap manis with the prunes. The bitterness is strong but well embodied in the beer. Not grassy, nor roasty. Flavours not layered, but well-rounded into a unique result. Incredibly well crafted. Full bodied, it is as oily as one would like for a Baltic Porter. Excellent stuff! Long chase finally over. Seal symbol, very Baltic. Im saving some other ratings to have a meaningful one for my 1000th.
.355l bottle @Bomb. Pours black with medium tan head. Aroma is coffee, syrup, liquorice, some hops, dark malts. Flavor is mostly same. Great.
Pours a very dark brown with a healthy orange-ish tan head. Dark roasted malt and custard on the nose. Moderately thick mouth feel. Flavors resemble the nose. Some faint fruitiness is noted as well.

12oz bottle airlift, BB 2019. Missed this at Braukunst Live, merci for the airlift idiosynkrasie! - Deep ebony brown pour, Cola bubbles head. Sharp liquorice molasses in aroma, more brandy burn than smoke or chocolate plum. Slick residual sugar mouthfeel, a tad unpleasant to the sucrose-sensitive palate. Liquorice & pear syrup drenched dried plums in flavour, unconvincing candy bar milk chocolate underneath. Salty liquorice stick (drop, lakrits) finish. I like this brewery, but this was somewhat underwhelming compared to a few Polish classics & their updates...

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pitch black with small tan head. Salty, licorice, char and brownies. Lovely complex mouth of char, salty licorice, roasted malt and chocolate. Smooth satine palate with a medium body and a long finish of salty licorice.

355 ml. bottle @ Home
- Aroma: not very intense aromas of roasted and toasted malts, hints of coffee, dark fruits, raisins, prunes, spices, alcohol.
- Appearance: very dark brown color with above average head thickness. Super creamy brown foam with good retention. No Brussels lacing. Its too dark but it seems clear.
- Taste: medium-to-high sweetness, low bitterness, very low sourness. Flavors of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, raisins, dark fruits, prunes. The alcohol level is not very noticeable.
- Palate: medium-to-full body, oily texture, low carbonation, short bittersweet finish with flavors of roasted malts, raisins, prunes, dark fruits, porto wine, dark chocolate. Very light hints of coffee, liquorice.
- Overall: good appareance. Not very intense aromas. Good flavors of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, raisins, dark fruits, prunes. Not very long bittersweet finish with the same flavors. Good beer.
Flaska at home. Smarrig saltdränkt doft med lakritsinslag. Smaken härlig lite salt med bra balans av lite lakrits. Rätt torr med en härlig men något kort eftersmak. Go porter!!

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Near black, a creamy khaki head, good lacing. Fudge and chocolate aroma, cocoa nibs, licorice and raisins. Full-bodied, soft carbonation, creamy and silky mouthfeel. Creamy fudge and toasty taste, sweet licorice, tobacco, ash, raisins and figs. Roasted cocoa bitter finish.
Bottle @ home, from Systembolaget. Almost pitch black pour with a tan head. Notes of ash, caramel, sweet dark malts, sweet chocolate liquorice and some light tar.
Trübes, sehr dunkles schwarzbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Stark malzig, reichlich Röstmalze, schwarzer Kaffee, Kakao, Bitterschokolade, etwas Vanille, leicht fruchtig, Waldbeeren, cremig.

Dark blackish brown pour with a small pale mocha head. Heavy malty and slightly roasty nose with rustic dark bread, chocolate and minerals. Sweet, tiny bitter and heavy malty taste. Soft, round and tiny astringent mouth. Medium to full bodied. light alcohol burn. Very malty and very tasty baltic porter. I dig it!

Bottle stamp is may 2015, 9%abv. Black with a thick mocha head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, licorice, anise, oak, and vanilla. Taste is chocolate, cocoa, licorice, cream, and oak. Taste is a bit alcoholic and dry in the finish.

Bottle, rating 7000. Black, brown foamy ring. Licorice and roast, dark fruit, fresh bread aroma. Sweet entry, burned sugar, caramel, soy, hard roasted candied fruit, raisins, dark roasted coffee. Initial rough notes give way to a sweeter fruity base balanced by bitter roasted notes, coffee. Light alcohol burn, dry on the palate, medium full body, mellow. Flambeed dark german fruitbread finish. Starbucks retronasal.
Bottle at home. Taste of sweet, soft liquorice, whipped cream in coffee, brown sugar, raisins and rye bread. Very smooth mouthfeel with a bitter aftertaste.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Very dark brown body. Tiny, tiny, brown head. Alcohol, wood, oak, nuts, smoke, leather, cherry, raisins, wine, port, chestnuts, herbal flavour. Very interesting. Sweet and bitter. Maybe a tad too bitter. Warming. Full body. Soft carbonation. Very good!
Bottle. Pitch black. Lots of Chocolate, coffee, df  in aroma, dry medium bitterness. Nice full mouthfeel.

Flaska från SB. Opak, mörkt brun vätska med lågt beige skum som snart försvinner. Stor doft av rostad malt med choklad, fudge, mörk torkad frukt, russin. Djup, komplex och koncentrerad smak med söt smakbild som ändå är riktigt drickbar och har riktigt bra balans.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a beige head. 
Sweet and slightöy vinous aroma with chocolate. 
Sweet and salty liquorice in the flavour along with some sweet, dries fruits. 
Dry bitterness.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av rostad malt, mörkt kaffe, choklad med toner av mörk sirap, smörkola och lakrits. Fina aromer, bra balans, krämig, rund och len. lagom sötma, fin beska.

355ml bottle. Pitch black with minimal beige head. Aroma is malty with chocolate, liqorice, almost smoky roasted malt tones and a very light, yet clearly noticeable, fruitiness. Taste offers an initial bitterness at the tip of the tongue later followed by a growing sweetness with full chocolate notes, black bread, light roasted tones, some liqorice and the same light fruitiness as was present in the aroma. Somewhat lively yet smoothly filling mouthfeel, prickly but very light carbonation and a lasting roasted chocolate aftertaste giving way to a refreshing sensation of the same light fruitiness from before paired with light chocolate and a memory of the roasted maltiness.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours pitch black with a nice tan head, that disappears quickly. Roasted aroma with coffee, chocolate, liquorice and leather. Smooth, roasted taste with dark chocolate, liquorice with earthy bitterness. Quite dry with just hints of sweetness. Short, roasted chocolatey finish.
Black color, small brown head. Roasted aromas with coffee, cacao, figs, slight earth and hops. Taste of chocolate, raisins, roasted malt, slight alcohol, long warming finish. Balanced and good.

Draft at the new brewery. Pours dark brown/black with a thick, creamy light brown head. Tastes like booze, burnt toast, dark roasted chocolate malt, and dark roasted coffee. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like chocolate syrup, booze, dark roasted chocolate, and dark roasted coffee.

Tap at brewery. Pours dark brown. Aroma is chocolate, cola, caramel, dark stone fruit, lager yeast esters, and some faint woody and toffee notes. Flavor matches the aroma with heavy dark chocolate notes, earthy bitterness, some faint sweetness, and a dry, woody finish. Medium/full body.

355ml bottle in the cellar for about six months. Pours black with a cocoa powder coloured head. On the nose, dark coffee, light smoke, cocoa, raisin, and faint molasses. Taste wise, sweet with molasses, dark maple syrup, dark coffee, raisin, and Panda licorice that heads into drier roasted malt notes, brown sugar, espresso, and light bitterness in the finish.

Pours black with a moderate mocha head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark chocolate, roasted nuts, slight cured leather, lactose. Taste is quite roasted and slightly smoky and charred with chocolate notes and a nice depth to it. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a dry finish. Very good!

@ Havregatan 20161118. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty and sweet with chocolate and licorice, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is long, roasted, bitter and sweet.

Nose is rich and full of dark fruits and some maltiness to go with coffee. Really dark and with small brownish head. Taste is also lots of coffee and ripe plums, dried fruit to go with some dark malts. Palate is long and sweet with only hints of hops. Delicious.
deep dark brow. tall, fine head. very nice aroma of coffee, chocolate, licorice. well-balanced taste. full body, very nice texture with lively carbonation. long, intense finish.

Almost black, nice beige head. Aroma of black malts, chocolate, dried fruits, dark bread. In taste light sweetness, dried fruits and bread with solid bitter finish. Full body, soft carbonation, smooth. Great baltic porter.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Niezbyt obfita piana, ale ładnie pozostająca. W aromacie pyszne ciemne pieczywo, suszone owoce i czekoladowa podbudowa. Pyszne, kawa z czekoladą, delikatnie grają suszone śliwki, pyszny posmak ciemnego pieczywa. Goryczka średnia do wysokiej, przyjemna, alkohol rozgrzewający, ale niewyczuwalny w smaku. Świetnie ułożone. Oleiste, wysycenie niskie.

Intense dark brown colour with low head.
Very intense and complex aroma. Sweet and roasty notes: caramel, toffee, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, milk and some black fruits and raisins. In mouth it is bitter but well balanced. Intense flavour and full body which hide the high alcohol content. Low carbonation. Long ending. Strong beer but easy to drink and totally enjoyable.
A top beer.

12 ounce bottle. Thanks John! Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, dark fruit, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, coffee, and caramel. Very tasty and very well made. Deserves its high rating.

Bottle pour into shake pint glass, from Cigarette City, Seabrook NH. Aroma is roasted malts with caramel, dark fruit, mild chocolate, some alcohol. Appearance is opaque black with 1/2 finger width light brown head with poor retention and no lacing. Taste is sweet roasted malts with caramel, notes of dark fruit, raisins, chocolate and some bitter coffee flavor for balance with mild alcohol taste. Palate is full bodied with soft, velvety texture, soft carbonation and mix of sweet/bitter, warm, pleasant finish. Overall, this isnt perfect (the alcohol is a little too apparent in the taste), but its close.
Bottle. Lots of pumpernikel, some raisins, oxidised in a good way, with honey and soy sauce fitting the picture. Subtle metal in the aroma, a faint salty note in the finish. Good.

Cerveza de color marrón oscuro con una buena cabeza de color marrón claro.El aroma es a malta tostada, frutas negras, café con notas de chocolate.El sabor es muy equilibrado entre el chocolate y el café con pasas secas en el acabado. Otra muy buena cerveza de una grandiosa fábrica de cerveza.
Single bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. Jet black with a frothy dark tan head. Very rich malty chocolate aromas and flavors. Nicely balanced. Long roasty dry finish. Quite chewy and thick.

Bottle. Nuts, raisins, dried fruits. Black, small head that vanishes completely. Delicious, lightly sweet, dried plums, bit of coffee. Full bodied, flat on carbo, light - medium bitter finish. Delicious beer, totally hits my taste.

Bottle from Whole Foods Lenox Hill. Dark black body with smooth silky head. Nose is sweet, malty, caramel. Taste is nice and smooth. Lots of caramel and plums and coffee and choolate. Nice oily texture. Really nice stuff.
Pours jet black with a decent cream colored head. Thick body for a porter. Good coffee flavor.
Black with tan head. Rye, spice, dark chocolate and licorice. Thick, sweet, slick, earthy and spicy finish. Overall: Very nice.

Bottle at home, 25th November 15. Pours black, lovely neat head. Aroma is liquorice, dark chocolate, milk, coffee. Taste is slight liquorice, dark chocolate, coffee, milkshake, really smooth and highly drinkable.

Merci à Guillaume Sigouin pour le partage. La bière est foncée, noire et pourvue dune belle mousse bien serrée qui malheureusement ne tient pas bien longtemps. Dommage car cette dernière est fort jolie. Les chaudes arômes granuleuses de torréfaction sont annonciatrices dun porter baltique réconfortant. En bouche le liquide est juste assez rond et moelleux sans toutefois être riche et sirupeux. Mes papilles et mon palais saccordent pour une expérience bien plus maltée que fruitée. En effet les grains bien rôtis libèrent une amertume plutôt sèche, laquelle ne provient pas des houblons qui demeurent présents et apportent un heureux équilibre. Moyennement longue en bouche et agréablement pétillante. Très jolie représentante de ce style dont la buvabilité est une des grandes qualités.

Barwa ciemna, niemalże czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Gęsta konsystencja, niemalże oleista. W aromacie karmel, kawa, przypieczona skórka od chleba i wychodzący na przód sos sojowy. Smak niezwykle intensywny, gorzka czekolada, kawa. Duża paloność, Alkohol dobrze schowany, wyczuwalny jedynie na początku w gardle poprzez rozgrzanie przełyku. Piwo to trochę różni się w porównaniu do porterów bałtyckich znad Bałtyku, niemniej jednak jest jednym z najlepszych. Wyróżnia się. Dodatkowo na plus: super etykieta i kapsel.

9% ABV- Has a sharp alcohol bite. Heavy on the chocolate malts with some other stuff going on. Jet black appearance with just a very slim mocha head. First sampled almost exactly 4 years ago. Both bottles were aged going on 1.5 years, so thinking this would do better after 3 or so.

Black, opaque, small brown foam, complex intense aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, some coffee roastiness, little bit of dark fruits, high sweetness, medium- bitterness, full body, quite thick but smooth feel, soft+ carbonation, long bittersweet, dry finishOverall: Complex, without a flaw, great-- rated with beerbasher
Mørk brun/svart farve med beige skum som avtar. Lukt av røstet malt, kaffe og frukt. Smak av røstet malt, kaffe og frukt. Søt maltavslutning. Vinmonopolet.
PINT tasting @ Moortgat. Black/ruby clear, light brown lacing foam. Coffee tones in aroma. Bitter taste with fruity tones, but not overwhelming. Just nice. (Arnhem 201511)

355 ml, bottled Jan. 2015, from Ammersin Centerstore.
Pitch black body, with a quite small, fluffy, coffee, colored head.
Aroma of melting dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice, dark and dried fruits, tobacco, nuts, dark bread.
Taste starts sweet, with dark chocolate, dark fruits, black tea, some dark bread and merges into a smooth, dry roastiness, with coffee, wood, liquorice, tobacco, cocoa powder.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, dry, roasty, medium bitter, with coffee, liquorice, tobacco, some wood, some cocoa, some alcohol warmth.

Delicious! Stunning that this is a bottom fermented Porter, big and complex as an Imperial Porter. Very smooth to drink, with a pleasant subtle warmth and wonderful, manifold dark malts. Clearly the best Baltic Porter Ive had so far.

Clear black opaque beer with short living brown head.

Aroma: robusta, burned bread, some pleasant mature alcohol notes.
Taste: almost dry with very light sweeteness and light to moderate biterness.
Flavour: coffee with alcohol, burned sourness, some berries.

Rich and good balanced, burned and warming.
Very good.

Appearance: Black. Aroma: Umami, Raisin, Malt, Syrup, Chocolate, espresso. Taste: Malt, Burnt, Roasted, Umami. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: caramel, caramel, chocolate, roasty, coffee, 
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Bottle from The Wine Emporium 301015. Another good beer from Smuttynose. Intense looking thick black with a layer of latte coloured foam. Oak, vanilla and toffee make for a smooth rich flavour.

Extremely dark brown color, almost black with medium tan head with low retention. Aroma has lots of cocoa, dark fruits, caramel, toffee and roasted malts. Medium to full body. Taste follows the aroma, licorice, dark chocolate, coffee, toasted malts, caramel, with a coffee bitterness on the aftertaste. Really complex Baltic Porter.

Dark, almost black pour with just a skim of brown foam that dissipated quickly. Aromas are roast and ripe fruit and raisin. Flavors of roast malt, coffee, and slight chocolate. This stuff is smooth as can be, finishing semi-sweet and fairly clean. Excellent.

22 oz. bottle, 2012 vintage, served in a glass snifter (from 2012 notes). 

Appearance: nearly black but with faint traces of brown. Topped by a moderate size, creamy/sudsy, light brown head than reduces to a ring and some islands all too quickly. Still able to leave lacing on the glass. 

Smell: Lots of chocolate for a beer without any actual cocoa; also dark malt and dark fruits, with a hint of coffee. Smells sweet. 

Taste: Chocolate, coffee, raisins, dark roasted malts and dark fruit flavors are all quite evident in this very flavorful beer. Despite the coffee component and some hop flavor, the brew is only mildly bitter. 

Mouthfeel: Creamy and smooth full body. Medium carbonation, perhaps a bit higher than expected, imparts some liveliness. 

Overall as good as any Baltic porter Ive had: Smuttys Baltic Porter is indeed a world-class beer. Flawlessly crafted, it has excellent aroma, taste and mouthfeel; looks great too. Wish I had bought another one to tuck away for a year.

Rated on 10-18-2015. The appearance is a fizzy and a very small light brown head with a short retention, opaque black body, fast rising carbonation on the sides of the glass, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is light roasted malt, chocolate, light coffee, and dark fruits. This beers flavor is lightly bitter, light roasted malt, earthy, dark fruits, and had a dry finish. The mouthfeel is smooth and lightly oily. This beer is medium bodied. This is a very drinkable beer with a very nice flavor. It is worth trying and it is a beer I would drink again.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0, Madrid, España
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, licorice, chocolate / Malta tostada, regaliz, chocolate.

Bottle. Pours a dark dark brown looking black in the glass, with a dark tan medium head. Aroma is rich malty with moderate roast, a whiff of alcohol, some vinous fruityness and leather. Taste is more roasty, but still malt-driven. Also some alcohol here, but its quite fitting with the taste and almost just gives a little warmth into the aftertaste. Lingering burnt coffee and grains bitterness. This is great stuff! Body is full and its velvety and smooth on the palate. Softly carbonated.

Bottle. Dark brown with a medium sized, lush, creamy head that was long lasting. Lots of lace. Aroma had hints of coffee and dried fruit. Taste was coffee with hints of fruit cake, and slow roasted grains. Sweet upfront and a nice smooth finish. Great winter warmer.

Butelka. Barwa ciemnobrunatna. Piana bardzo drobna, beżowa, szybko opadajaca. Aromat rodzynek, gorzkiej czekolady, śliwek, kawy. Aromat świetny. W smaku ciemne słody, rodzynki. Piwo ma konsystencję oleistą, gęstą. Bardzo aksamitne w odczuciu. Goryczka niewysoka ale zauważalna. Świetne piwo.

Schönes Porter, hatte aber bereits viel viel bessere.
Schöne kleine Krone, erinnert an Kaffee. Röstaromen und ein wenig Asche, sowie Kakao und Caramell in der Nase. Sehr alkoholisch.
Geschmacklich schön herb und stark am Anfang, ölig und weich in der Mitte und leicht süß im Abgang.
Während des Trinkens viel Abwechslung. Fruchtige Noten, Asche, Milchige Säure und dann wieder Frucht.
War nicht die erwartete Granate, aber allemal ein tolles Porter!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, niska, szybko opada.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Kapitalny zapach. Rodzynki, pumpernikiel, śliwka suszona, gorzka czekolada, delikatne nuty palone.
SMAK: Ciemne słody, ponownie rodzynki. Posmak kawy oraz gorzkiej czekolady. Aksamitne, gęste, oleiste. Alkohol świetnie uzupełnia wszystkie doznania smakowe.
OGÓLNIE: Fenomenalne piwo. Najlepszy Porter Bałtycki jaki kiedykolwiek miałem okazję pić/degustować. Klasa!

Bottle at a restaurant poured a small foamy light brown colored head of finely sized bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind an opaque dark black brown colored body with no visible carbonation. They aroma was mild with dark brown malty notes and a hint or raisin. The palate begins with a roasted malt note and we ends with a tingly hop malt aftertaste. The flavor was of roasted malt, dark malt and crisp hops. Another excellent brew from the brew masters of Smuttynose.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, coffee
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Sample at SBWF 2015. 

Black with a tan head. Aroma and taste of licorice, roasted malt, some dark chocolate and hints of dried fruit. The mouthfeel was thick and the aftertaste long. A nice one.
Fantastic mouthfeel to a dark opaque brown porter served in a tulip glass at the Bulls Head. Coffee aroma and flavor with a lingering anise and chocolate finish.

I love it that when you pour a beer like this you have the feeling something great is going to happen. It sliiiiides rather than pours, it settles as if it is sitting in a comfy lounge, and it know it belongs. Stuffynose really. Look at it, a great dense black body and delightful crema. Each sip leaves a lovely lacing down the glass. I should be criticised for copyright infringement but yes, coffee, dark fruit and raisins. Maybe fig too. Dense bold mouthfeel and flavour with a spiritous endnote. Not trying to be Putin anyone down at all but Im glad to see the Russians have given the world something of value.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text:
Bottle conditioned in January, 2015.
This was poured into an English pint glass.
The appearance was a pure dark jet black pour. A slight one and a half finger white to off white foamy head dissipated within less than a minute. Lacing just quickly slides into the beer.
The smell starts off with sweet rich dark chocolate with a nice leading edge of some dark fruits coming in lightly to keep it sweet. Light bitter and roasty coffee beans show some nice balance to boot in the aroma.
The taste follows through in the previously noted aromas. The lager yeast helps a tad little bit of breadiness to make a smooth transition to the aftertaste and give off a sly little bit of semi-sweet sticky little bit of a finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium in body with a good sessionability about it. Carbonation runs really light causing a big stickiness to develop and surround my tongue.
Overall, I say this was a really nice Baltic Porter, maybe I just could have had it at the right time too. It really aged nicely!
On tap at Archive. A murky black brew that paints the head brown. Rich taste, a meal in a glass, with flavours ranging from coffee to dried fruit. Well matched with their porter and beef cheeks pie.

Bomber. Pours black with a dissipating brown head and aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, and dark fruits. Taste is strong, with liquorice and dark fruits along with roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee notes into the finish.

With Z, pours a deep dark black pour with no appreciable head. Nose is deep and heavy malt with some vanilla fruit. Taste is thick malt, dark fruit with a hint of Java. Finishes on the same tasting notes with a rather long and dry ending. Quaff Score 7 / 10

Aroma: toast, pumpernickel bread, caramel, plum, licorice, soy sauce in the backgroud
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, toast, lightly roasted, pumpernickel bread, caramel
Smooth, full body.
Fantastic, well balanced beer

Aromat: słodowy, wyraźnie słodki, z nutami karmelu, orzechów włoskich, tostów, nieco suszonych owoców (śliwki, wiśnie), porto, czekolady, kawy. Ogólnie gładki, alkohol dobrze ukryty.


Wygląd: barwa niestety czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa/ jasno brązowa, średnio pęcherzykowa, niewielka i niezbyt trwała. To najsłabszy punkt tego piwa.


Smak: na bogato. Czekolada, leciutka paloność, kawa, owoce suszone. Początkowo słodko, ale ciemne słody jednak zwyciężają, nadając nutę kwaskową. Mocno, ale gładko. Goryczka umiarkowana, idealnie dobrana by zapewnić balans ze słodem. Krągła pełnia, niskie (zbyt) wysycenie i ciemno słodowy (głównie czekoladowy), kwaskowy i alkoholowy , rozgrzewający przełyk finisz.


Jeden z najlepszych, o ile nie najlepszy Bałtyk jaki piłem. Aromat świetny, barwa zbyt ciemna i piana słaba, jednak smak również bardzo dobry, z alkoholem jedynie na finiszu. Nieco za dużo kwaskowości. Ogólnie jednak warto było wydać na nie 20 zł.
czy to najleprzy baltic porter jaki w życiu piłem - bez wątpienia tak! Czy piwo warte jest swojej ceny - raczej nie.

Bottle to glass. Pours a thin deep brown to black color with a tan head. Aroma is roasty, burnt, touch of coffee. Flavor is burnt coffee, roasted malts, lager yeast. Not bad. A bit thin, but goes down easy.

Raisin, rum, date and butterscotch dominate the nose on this deep brown beauty. Almost zero head sits atop the silly dark nectar. The flavour is not as sweet as the nose suggests. More robust with delightfully rich dark chocolate flavours balanced with some burnt caramels and hints of coffee. Gets better as it warms up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, light roast. Tastes of caramel, toffee, light booze. Medium body with a dry finish.

Without a complimentary food it is very standard. Chocolate and caramel scent. A light palate. Basic Baltic porter, BUT I had it with pine nuts and suddenly it is the most amazing beverage. Has sugars, and almost a mint flavor. The cocoa pops and a rich hazelnut comes out. Not thick but not thin. Tap

Aromat: kawa, śliwka, paloność, w tle czekolada.
Wygląd: barwa czarna, piana potężna, drobnopęchrzykowa, beżowa, pięknie oblepia szkło.
Smak: słodycz kawowo-śliwkowa, dellikatna czekolada, spora palona goryczka.
Tekstura: dużo ciała, jednak nie jest za bardzo likierowe, umiarkownie wysycenie.
Ogólne wrażenie: świetna interepretacja stylu, bogaty aromat i smak, odpowiednia ilość ciała, dobry balans między słodyczą i goryczką, alkohol fajnie ukryty, zaskakująco pijalne. Obecnie najlepszy porter bałtycki jaki piłem.

W aromacie czekoladowy likier, gorzka czekolada, lukrecja, suszone owoce, nieco alkoholu. W smaku podobnie dominuje odczucie likieru z gorzkiej czekolady z subtelnymi wtrętami suszonych owoców, rodzynek i jagód. Alkohol mógłby być lepiej ukryty, szczególnie, że nie ma go w tym piwie zbyt wiele. Pełne i bogate jak RIS, za to duży plus, ale nie jest aż tak dobre jakby sugerowała ocena. Ale 2 klasy lepszy niż polskie portery bałtyckie (minus imperator)

6 oz pour from tap at 54 degrees into tiny sniffer at Churchkey. Dark brown and opaque with a creamy light brown head. The head looks like the bubbles in chocolate milk. Nose is sweet, milk chocolate, coffee, caramel, and a little roasty. Full is full and a bit dry. Creamy too. Taste is less sweet than I would have expected. Roasty, chocolate, coffee, a little nuttiness. A bit bitter.

Aromat to przede wszystkim śliwka w czekoladzie, rodzynki, szlachetna nuta alkoholowa. Trochę szkoda, że nie da się zbudować żadnej piany. 
W smaku - uczta - na początku kawowe aromaty, gorzka czekolada, szybko uzupełnione śliwką, suszonymi owocami i lekko dymną nutą. W tle nuty tytoniowe, palone, goryczka średnia, bardzo przyjemna. Gdyby tylko nie ciut zbyt wysokie wysycenie byłby ideał.

Nera impenetrabile, forma una schiuma color nocciola non troppo abbondante che nel giro di un minuto sparisce immediatamente, lasciando il cerchio nel bicchiere ed una lievissima patina. Certo, la birra è bella e nera come la notte, bella profonda. Inizialmente, ma io lho lasciata raffreddare troppo, porta al naso un bel profumo di prugna. Questo apre laroma, ma si lascia seguire da vaniglia, latte, leggermente la liquirizia. In secondo piano, invece, le tostature con il sentore dellorzo sul punto di ebollizione presente. Aroma vario, abbastanza intenso e che sopratutto predispone nel migliore dei modi la bevuta. Limbocco è molto dolce. Inizialmente, si avverte il sapore della componente dolce, molta vaniglia, che però trova subito un buon equilibrio, con i malti tostati, tipo orzo, che bilanciano subito la bevuta. è solo un intervallo però, perché si sento poi la frutta disidratata. penso alla prugna, ma anche il dattero devo dire. è una birra che gioca bene sullequilibrio, parte dolce ma viene smorzata dallamaro, non bruscamente ma dolcemente. Quando sembra chiudere amara, in maniera noiosa poi, si ripresenta dolce, richiamando una dolcezza palatale molto pronunciata. Non è secca alla fine, quindi, ma è piacevole. Morbida, ha una carbonatazione media ed al palato non è particolarmente avvolgente. Un peccato, forse, perché una maggiore sensazione vellutata forse avrebbe reso la birra ancora più interessante. Ma si tratta di una baltic porter, quindi credo sia abbastanza in linea con lo stile. Nel retrogusto ritorna anche la vaniglia, ma è tutta la componente dolce che si ripresenta. Non è mai stucchevole, però. E questo, credo sia un punto vantaggiosissimo.
little bit strong for me. But Rich flavor and a scent of dark chocolate is great. Its like drinking bitter americano.

Tap. Pours and easy 5, thick pitch black with dense ever-lasting brown head. Aroma is very sweet and fudgy, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla and roasty coffee. The roast really compliments the sweet notes and all the dried fruits, dates and port grapes, slight oxidation and something reminiscent of light leather. Really complex for the style. Tate is sweet, port grapes and some acidic sherry. Again this is complex. Chocolate milk, dark bitter chocolate, fresh ground and pressed coffee and raisins. Roasty coffee and light dry cocoa finish. No sight of the ABV. Really smooth and chocolate milk-like. Turns from sweet to more roasty. Very very well balanced.
Bottle @ Kufle i Kapsle, Warsaw. Nice creamy head with excelkent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, licorice, dark fruits, chocolate, coffee and hops.
Bottle @ Kufle i Kapsle. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and licorice. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 310715
Bottle. Pours black with very little head. Nose is chocolate, coffee and licorice. Taste same with some bitterness and alcohol. Great.
Doesnt have a strong, extremely appetizing aroma but sits great on the palate and easily drinkable.

Robe bien noire petit collet persistant.
Aromes torréfiés bien cafe et un peu boisé. 
Ronde a souhait un peu sirupeuse mais sans excès reglisse et café en bouche.
Longue comme il faut. Un vrai petit regal.

Bottle. Black with a modest tan head that doesnt last all that well. Aroma of prunes, licorice, coffee, moderate roast. Medium bodied; smooth with moderate carbonation. Lots of coffee and dried fruit, gently tapering sweetness into a clean slightly bitter finish. Fine stuff, smooth and very easy drinking for 8.7%.

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się sycząca brązowa pianka, szybko opada praktycznie do zera, barwa ciemno brązowa, prawie czarna. Aromat przypomina śliwki w czekoladzie połączone z likierem kawowym, w tle minimalna paloność - nie jest zbyt intensywny, aczkolwiek przyjemny. W smaku na pierwszym miejscu likier kawowy i gorzka czekolada plus sos sojowy, trufle, marcepan, nieco wanilii... Generalnie wszystko to jest bardzo intensywne, wyraźne, nie trzeba się doszukiwać. Goryczka początkowo delikatna po chwili dochodzi do średniej. W afterteasie nuty tytoniowe, alkohol wyraźny, ale dobrze wkomponowany, fajnie rozgrzewa, odczucie w ustach nieco powyżej półpełnego, lekko popiołowe, lepkie. Nagazowanie średnie, ciut za wysokie jak na ten styl - zapewne to + wysoki alkohol sprawiły, że piana przypominała tą z coli. 
Bardzo udany Porter Bałtycki, treściwy, wyrazisty, wszystkie składowe smaku tworzą świetnie ułożoną całość. Nie potrzeba tu leżakowania, ponieważ jest to trunek kompletny. Gdyby jeszcze zmniejszyć nasycenie...
Nose is prune, raisin, faint dark chocolate. Flavor is same plus blueberry, espresso, char, earthy.

Handpump @Bibere Bistrot (Rome). Pours deep brown with a medium cappuccino head. Aroma of roasted malts, lot of chocolate and some mocha, vanilla, amazing. Flavour is sweet with a light bitter end, chocolate and coffee. Full body, light carbonation. Wow!
12 oz bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Cocoa and molasses aroma. Raisin, cocoa, and molasses flavor. A pretty good one.
Bottle. Black colour with brown head. Chocolate and roasted aroma. Chocolate, sweet, vanilla, roasted, coffee taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle, pours dark black with a small creamy head. Aromas of roasted coffee and chocolate. Taste the same with vanilla and a little sweetness. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Deep red, dark colour and not so creamy head. Not strong, refreshing aroma of hop is crisp. Almost full body, and dark malt flavour like black currant and coffee. Dry finish with a little astringent and grassy hop-bitter. A outstanding one of the baltic porters!

355ml bottle. Pours black with a small light beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee chocolate, some caramel sweetness, light dark fruits. Taste is similar, a bit stronger, good chocolate and roasted flavors. Full body, smooth oily mouthfeel, light carbonation. Very good.
Bottle to glass. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate. Taste is chocolate, some mild bitterness, lingers a bit in the finish. Clean other than the bitterness. Tasty.
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Dark black pour with a nice chocolate head. Aromas of dark fruit chocolate and malt. Taste follows with a nice mouth feel and pleasant finish.

Negro opaco y espuma beis densa y persistente. Aromas de chocolate, melaza, frutos rojos y cereal dulce. Cuero medio, sedoso y limpio, inicio dulce frutos ronos y melaza, final de amargor de chocolate negro.
